message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of selecting an optimal set of measurements in a Bayesian network, which is a common problem in artificial intelligence and machine learning (cs.AI). The use of approximation algorithms and the relaxation of input monotonicity assumption suggest a focus on optimization and algorithm design (cs.LG). The paper also deals with dependency structures and performance profiles, which are concepts commonly studied in data science (cs.DS) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the application of the extended scheme to selecting a subset of measurements for minimizing the worst variance in a Gaussian BN suggests a focus on control and systems engineering (cs.SY).
